data.title: Alan Sakar Azuara
data.meta_description: Alan Sakar is a Senior Associate in the Global Financial Markets Group.Alan has experience on international finance transactions, capital markets, merger and acquisitions, and other corporate finance and general corporate matters.
data.text:
Project Finance

Reden Development Chile SpA in connection with the US$81 million financing provided by Natixis for the construction and development of a portfolio of 10 solar projects under the PMGD regime, with a combined capacity of 100MW once fully operational

CIFI as senior and subordinated lender, mandated lead arranger and administrative agent, in connection with the financing of a portfolio of solar photovoltaic projects in Chile under the PMGD program

CAF and other lenders in the project financing provided to a SPV owned by Canadian Solar for the development of the 100.1MW Cafayate solar power project in Argentina under the RenovAr program; Latin America Project Finance Deal of the Year, Power Finance Risk Awards 2019

SMBC, KfW, SocGen, IDB Invest, FDN, ICO, CAF and other lenders in the multi-currency financing of the Autopista Al Mar 1 toll road project in Colombia, developed by a consortium including Concay, Sacyr, and Strabag SE; Infrastructure Financing of the Year: Andes, and Road Financing of the Year, Latin Finance Awards 2019

Bancomext, ING and KfW on the financing of a 300MW PV project in San Luis Potosi, Mexico, which was awarded under the second Mexican clean energy auction and is being developed by Fotowatio Renewable

Altán Redes in the US$1.5 billion financing for the construction of the largest telecommunications network in Mexico, Red Compartida; Best Loan and Best Infrastructure Financing: Mexico, Latin Finance Awards 2017

AELA Group, a joint venture owned by Actis and Mainstream Renewable Power, on the financing of the development of the 170MW Sarco and 129MW Aurora wind farms located in Chile and the refinancing of the 33MW Cuel wind farm project; LatAm Renewable Deal of the Year; PFI Awards 2017; Onshore Wind Deal of the Year, IJGlobal Awards 2017

IFC, DEG, Proparco and a syndicate of other lenders in connection with the long-term financing of the construction and operation of a 215MW Penonome II wind farm located in Panamá

IFC, IDB and the commercial bank B lenders in the financing of container terminals in the Port of Manzanillo; Best Port Financing, Latin Finance Awards 2016

Corporate Finance

CA-CIB in the ECA financing to be provided to a subsidiary of Industrias Peñoles, S.A.B. de C.V. in Mexico

Banco Nacional de México in the US$70 million financing to Banco Compartamos S.A. Institución de Banca Múltiple, Mexico’s largest microfinance institution, guaranteed by US International Development Finance Corporation (DFC), which proceeds will be used to provide micro loans to women-owned small businesses in Mexico

Bank of America as lender in connection with a ESG $10 million uncommitted loan to Bancolombia

Scotiabank as lender in connection with a US$55 million loan to EGE Haina in Dominican Republic

Banco General as lender in connection with a $50 million loan to Grupo Pantaleon

Banco General as lender in connection with a $15 million loan to Gemcorp

Capital Markets

Investors and KEXIM in the US$401 million refinancing via private placement under the 4(a)(2) rule of the 433MW Norte II gas-fired plant developed by KEPCO, Samsung and Techint; Best Power Deal, IJGlobal Awards 2019

Investors in the US$70 million 4(a)2 private placement for the financing of the 850MW and 94MW CCGT projects with PPAs with CFE Calificados; Infrastructure Financing of the Year 2019: Mexico

Reden Solar on the US$135 million 4(a)2 private placement refinancing of 21 solar projects under the PMGD regime

Underwriters in the US$890 million IPO of CFE FIBRA E, sponsored by Mexico’s Federal Electricity Commission (CFE); the transaction was the first global IPO by a FIBRA E and awarded; 2018 Equities Deal of the Year – Americas by The Banker

M&A and Corporate

Credivalores-Crediservicios on capitalization transaction involving new strategic partner GDA Luma
